Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content:
@coingirl87 there is obviously bots trading all markets. Without buyers, the bot will push the price down to buy more and push price up when it wants to sell.

Marketing has nothing to do with this, unless you think marketing = fomo.

Effective marketing where it leads to user adoption and devs building on KMD is what we need. The marketing team is doing this and the fruits of this will play out over time.

There is no flashy $2m paid partnerships unless the community is willing to fund it. With 32BTC in KMD, it is in your best interest to help KMD get out there. This is where community marketing comes into play https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/4b7b/3bd9826fa6da81d8a7a3aa3ede3010dc7b45.pdf

Word of mouth gives better results, unless you SPEND LOTS & LOTS of money to EVEN out the effects .

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content:
The question everyone should ask themselves, if i believe that the price will keep going down, should i sell? If the answer is you dont want to sell then the next question is, how can i help get user adoption which will result in more people buying/knowing about KMD.

Saying you have no time, is saying that you dont care if your investment goes down, which is fine, it is your money. If you are saying i should get paid to do something, the answer is you dont care if your investment goes down. If you are saying some magical unicorn will appear and they will make the price magically go up, you are saying you dont care if the price goes down.

So at the end of the day if you do want your investment to go up, take some action to make sure that it does. Go out and do dex testing, go on social and let people know about KMD, create a meeting for like minded people to think up of ideas on how we can market better.

Author: Flint#6435
Content: the fact is that these are not bots - because red candles with their length indicate panic sales! bots do not so sharply drop the price! it’s people who are disappointed in the coin they sell to buy a growing bitcoin whose dominance is close to 80% - this will bury the altcoin market for a long time!

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: I am not saying 100% is bots as you said, people that dump large amounts at a time are people that want to get into BTC.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: But for the most part, bots pushes the market in the direction it wants it to go in, real traders amplify this effect.
